record.title: FOSTERING CONNECTIONS TO SUCCESS AND INCREASING ADOPTIONS ACT OF 2008
record.narrative:
FOSTERING CONNECTIONS TO SUCCESS AND INCREASING ADOPTIONS ACT OF 2008 -- (Senate - September 22, 2008)

[Page: S9218]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that we now proceed to the immediate consideration of H.R. 6893.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

A bill (H.R. 6893) to amend Parts B and E of title IV of the Social Security Act to connect and support relative caregivers, improve outcomes for children in foster care, provide for tribal foster care and adoption access, improve incentives for adoption, and for other purposes.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read three times and passed, the motions to reconsider be laid upon the table, there be no intervening action or debate, and any statements relating to this matter be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (H.R. 6893) was ordered to a third reading, was read the third time, and passed.
